response.answer_text: As of now, there are 26 countries in the Schengen zone, and Belgium is one of them. So, to visit Belgium you need Schengen Belgium Visa. There are various policies of Belgium Schengen Visa that you should know. If you are a citizen of the EU nationals then you won’t require a Belgium Visa to visit the country, but as an Indian citizen, you will require to have Belgium visa for Indians.  Below mentioned is the process to apply for a Belgium visa and the documents required for Belgium visa. How to apply for a Belgium Visa? For obtaining Belgium visa from India, you need to determine the purpose of the visit. Since the offline process is not available, you have to apply for a Belgium visa online. The steps are as follows- Create an account on the Belgium Embassy website.Fill in the application form online with the personal details.Book the visa appointment at the VAC, Embassy or Consulate.Take out the print out of the application form you received on your email id.Attend the Belgium visa appointment for your biometric along with all the documents.Pay the Belgium visa fees.Once the Belgium visa application has been submitted, it will be processed by the Belgium embassy/consulate.Documents required for Belgium Visa The documents required for Belgium visa depends on the type of visa you are going to apply. However, the general list of documents required for Schengen Belgium visa is as follows- Short-term Belgium Schengen Visa (C Visa):A Passport, valid for the 6 months ahead of the span of stay.Covering letter mentioning the details of the applicant.Travel Itinerary.Confirmed Air Tickets.Travel Insurance.Proof of Occupation.Bank statements to show sufficient funds.Long-term Visa (D Type):A valid Passport.Proof of admission at an educational institute.Financial documents to show that you have sufficient funds to cover your expenses in the country.Proof of Accommodation.Certificate showing that there are no criminal records on your name.Note: Collect all the required documents for the Belgium visa before applying.

Whether or not you need a visa to enter Belgium the process is dependent on a variety of factors: your nationality, the length of your intended stay, the reason for your visit or stay and what other documents you’ve applied for or received. Nationals of the European Union countries don’t need a visa to enter Belgium, whether for a short or long stay. You are, however, subject to various registration requirements, particularly if you’re staying longer than 90 days. Nationals of other countries may or may not be subject to visa requirements. In order to find out if you need a visa, you can visit the FPS Foreign Affairs website.  For visits of up to 90 days within any six month period, nationals of Australia, the US and Canada do not require a visa. All EU nationals, whether from a Schengen country or not, can stay for an unlimited period of time without a visa. However, those staying for longer than three months must obtain a residence permit. If you’re a non-EU resident staying on BelgiumVisa longer than 90 days, you must have a visa stamped in your passport before you enter the country. To obtain a visa you should apply in person to your local consulate or embassy long before leaving home.
